title.rendered: Special Events and Highlights at September’s Second Sunday on Main

content.rendered:
You probably already know that this Second Sunday on Main willÂ be filled with amazing dance performances as we mentioned in our last post. However, there are so many other fun aspects of Second Sunday that we couldn’t fit them all in one post.

As with every Second Sunday…

– Local vendors will be selling all kinds of goods. Craving home baked goods? On the hunt for vintage clothing and accessories? Searching for handcrafted furniture? Second Sunday vendors have it all!
– Moerlein’s outdoor beer garden can quench your thirst with a delicious beer.
– The shops, galleries, and restaurants of Main Street will be open for the day, and many will be offering sales and specials. Check out just a few of the options you can enjoy this Sunday!


MOTR Brunch

Brunch at Second Sunday on Main

Enjoy brunch on Main Street at MOTR (1345 Main Street) from 10 AM to 2 PM or Park + Vine (1202 Main Street) from 11 AM – 2 PM.

If you’re heading to MOTR, try the migas tacos, breakfast burrito, or one of their rotating weekly brunch specials. Chase brunch with one of MOTR’s award-winning Bloody Mary’s. Â IfÂ Park + Vine is more your speed, the all-vegan brunch includes a tofu scramble, biscuits and gravy, gluten-free pancakes and waffles, fresh La Terza coffee, smoothies, and more. Check out their full brunch menu.

Of course, you can also grab a quick bite from one of our many fantastic food trucks.Â Câ€™est Cheese, Dojo Gelato, and Fireside Pizza will all return in September.

Rock Paper Scissors’ Grand Opening

New OTR neighbors Rock Paper Scissors will officially open their doors on Second Sunday. The new art supply and local record store at 1301 Main Street will celebrate their grand opening with door prizes and live music by Archer’s Paradox, Ben Rush (formerly of Enlou), and jazz by Ben Thomas, Peter Gemus, and Oz Landesberg.Â RSVP on Facebook
